title: Email di un singolo account duplicate
content:
Ho 6 account nella mia installazione di Thunderbird e capita che le mail di un singolo account vengano mostrate duplicate nella visualizzazione a cartelle unificate. Aprendo la inbox dell'account, tornano singole, tornando alla Inbox unificata, dopo la "ricerca cartella..." che spunta in basso, tornano doppioni. Per risolvere mi basta chiudere il programma e riaprirlo (non ridotto a icono, ma totalmente chiuso e riavviato).

Non riesco a capire perché a volte, all'apertura di thunderbird, le email siano doppione costringendomi a riavviare il programma. In modalità risoluzione problemi questo non spunta, ma immagino sia perché appunto riavviando thunderbird si sistema.

Controllando le impostazioni account, non c'è niente di diverso rispetto agli altri utenti gmail.

Elimimando una mail doppiona, sparisce anche l'altra lasciando una mail vuota datata 1970. Cambiando cartella si sistema.
creator: andreabarbagallo.ab7

title: verzenden van email vanuitThunderbird lukt niet
content: Sinds een paar dagen kan ik geen mail meer verzenden via Thunderbird. Wel via mijn Ipad, maar niet via mijn laptop. Ik heb geprobeerd dit op te lossen: door windows update, thunderbird opnieuw te installeren met een nieuw wachtwoord, firewall,vpn en virusprogramma uit te zetten, niets helpt. De boodschap die ik krijg is: ''Verzenden van het bericht is mislukt. Het bericht kon niet worden verzonden, omdat het verbinden met uitgaande (SMTP-)server smtp.freedom.nl is mislukt. Mogelijk is de server niet beschikbaar of weigert SMTP-verbindingen. Controleer of de instellingen van uw uitgaande (SMTP-)server juist zijn en probeer het opnieuw.' ik weet niet wat ik nog meer kan proberen, groet, Pauline

title: Version 138.0 blocks sending and receiving email
content:
since installing Version 138.0 this mornuing (by automatad update) thunderbird doesn't send and receive email. All accounts state (in German) "Nachrichten konnten nicht in die Mailbox-Datei geschrieben werden. Stellen Sie sicher, dass das Dateisystem Ihnen Schreibrechte einräumt und genügend Speicherplatz zur Verfügung steht, um die Mailbox zu kopieren."

So Messages cound't be written to the Mailbox-file.

I tryed to delete an reinstall thunderbird with no effort. There is enough space on the hdd and all 'rights' are O.K. Other e-Mail-programs such as outlook can receive eMail from this accounts.

title: lokale mappen van harde schijf overzetten
content:
Beste mensen,

Ik denk dat ik iets gedaan heb dat niet handig is. Het volgende:

Ik heb op een nieuwe pc thunderbird geinstalleerd, de emailaccounts toegevoegd. Dat is gelukt.

Mijn partner Joop heeft veel lokale mappen gemaakt en daar de mails naar toegeschoven. Nog op de oude pc. Ik ben ervan uitgegaan dat deze lokale mappen op de harde schijf van de oude pc staan. Deze harde schijf heb ik aangesloten op de nieuwe pc, maar nu vind ik niet de lokale mappen. Waar kan ik deze vinden?

Op de nieuwe pc laadt thunderbird de lokale mappen niet automatisch in. dus ik neem aan dat ik deze zou moeten kunnen importeren vanaf de 'oude' harde schijf.

Kan iemand mij helpen, want ik kom er niet uit.

Hoop op een reactie , hartelijke groet, Liesbeth
creator: huson1

title: Thunderbird - adding non-default address to mailing list
content:
How do I add a person's non-default email address to a mailing list?

I have a mailing list for our golf league, and in my address book many of those in the list have both a work and home email address, with one marked as the default. Some of our members would like messages sent to the list to go to both addresses. But I haven't found a way to add a person's non-default address to the list.

Do I need to create two address book entries for each of these people, one for each email address, and separately add them both to the list? That seems awfully klunky/inefficient to me.

title: emails disappeared during transfer to local folders
content:
Hi I received an email from quota-warning@localhost "Your mailbox is now 95% full, please consider deleting old messages to still be able to receive new mails in the future", which I'm not even clear whether it came from my Thunderbird or my email provider as there is nothing to identify the sender.

Anyway I proceeded to transfer emails to my local folders thinking it might sort the problem.

Transferred one whole folder ok.

Next tried to transfer a bunch of selected/highlighted emails from my inbox but got another not enough space pop up which said I should delete the trash and compact folders, so I did that (I may still have had the emails highlighted during this process). Nothing notable happened so I tried again to transfer the emails. They disappeared from the inbox but when I went to check the local target folder they had not appeared there.

So I looked everywhere but no sign of them. Tried various searches but nothing. Tried properties/repair folder but nothing. Looked on my email providers webmail service and there also they were gone completely.

These are very important emails to do with house sales, tax stuff, deaths of family members and much more so I'm in a pretty panic as you can imagine.

Hopefully this is a common problem and there is a solution.

My Thunderbird is 128.9.0esr (updated quite recently) running on PCLinuxOS and downloaded through synaptic package manager .

Any help would be very much appreciated.
creator: 23justinrose

title: Thunderbird 128.10.0 Filter's not saving email with attachment
content:
Hello,

I have a filter setup within Thunderbird 128.10.0 that was working properly up until I updated Thunderbird in April to the previous build. Today I updated to 128.10.0 and am still having the issue.

The filter has two steps. 1) Save the attachment that is in the email to disk 2) Move email to trash.

Step 1 is not working (save attachment to disk), but step 2 does (email gets moved to trash).

When I go into the filter settings and manually run the rule, the filter works properly.

Any suggestions?

title: Having trouble with digital signature/encryption settings on Ubuntu 20
content:
I regularly send/receive encrypted email on Windows with Outlook but seeing as most of my work is done on my Ubuntu partition, I was interested in a Linux solution. I was able to connect to my exchange server using owl automagically and see my email, no problem. I had some experience getting smart-card readers working on Ubuntu so I already had some things in place using the OpenSC Security Device. TB was able to talk to my card reader, grab the certificates, and I was able to set my S/MIME digital signing and encryption certificates. It definitely works, I can decrypt messages that I had already received in the way I expect, it checks if I have a card inserted, asks for me PIN, and the message decrypts correctly as I would expect. The issue is that if I try to send a signed email to myself, I get the error, "Sending of the message failed. You specified that this message should be digitally signed, but the application either failed to find the signing certificate specified in your Mail & Newsgroup Account Settings, or the certificate has expired." A similar message is sent if I try to encrypt (but not sign) a message to myself but for the encryption certificate.

I don't understand this message, as TB can definitely see my card, ask my card for my private key, and use it to decrypt messages, so I believe my E2E settings are correct. Neither certificate is expired, both expire sometime in 2027. I even added my companies root certificate to my Certificate Authorities in TB, so I don't believe it's an issue with my certificate being deemed invalid, and the error message certainly doesn't suggest as much. I've also tried both of my card-readers in case something was only looking at the first one, but both can be signed into correctly but neither let me send signed/encrypted email. The only clues I can see are the console error in my terminal when the message fails to send...

console.error: mailnews.send: "Sending failed; , exitCode=2147500037, originalMsgURI="

Also when I open a remote debugging session, this is the error shown...

mailnews.send: NS_ERROR_FAILURE: Component returned failure code: 0x80004005 (NS_ERROR_FAILURE) [nsIMsgComposeSecure.beginCryptoEncapsulation] 

   _startCryptoEncapsulation resource:///modules/MimeMessage.jsm:510    _writePart resource:///modules/MimeMessage.jsm:558

Does anyone know what I might be doing wrong and nudge me in the correct direction?
creator: alexlambleypersonal

title: Hotmail is niet werkend te krijgen met Oauth2
content:
Sinds de invoer van de Oauth2 methode lukt het mij niet om Hotmail in Thunderbird weer werkend te krijgen. Ik kan niets verzenden en niets ontvangen. Het hulp artikel hierover heb ik op de voet gevolgd:

  • Mijn versie van Thunderbird is up to date
  • Verificatie in twee stappen is ingesteld
  • Cookies zijn ingeschakeld
  • Gebruikersnaam en wachtwoord zijn correct (werken wel via de browser)
  • Ongeacht of ik voor inkomende mail de IMAP of POP3-server kies, krijg ik dezelfde foutmelding "Aanmelden bij server is niet mogelijk. Waarschijnlijk een onjuiste configuratie, gebruikersnaam of wachtwoord".

Nadat ik het Hotmail account uit Thunderbird had verwijderd, lukte het eerst helemaal niet meer om het opnieuw toe te voegen (ook niet na herstarten). De enige manier waarop het wel bleek te kunnen was toen ik bij POP3 poort 993 invulde (in plaats van default 995). Er verscheen "Account met succes aangemaakt. U kunt deze account nu gebruiken met Thunderbird". Maar helaas blijkt dat niet zo te zijn, met geen van beide genoemde poortnrs., niet met IMAP, niet met POP3 en ook de uitgaande SMTP werkt niet met de default instellingen. Kortom: ik kan nog steeds Thunderbird niet gebruiken voor mijn Hotmail account (bij voorkeur via de POP3-server). Wie heeft er een idee, iets dat ik nog niet heb geprobeerd? Ik hoor het graag!
creator: moiragh
